name: Diabetes
description: A chronic disease that affects how your body turns food into energy.
prevention: Maintain a healthy diet, exercise regularly, avoid excessive sugar intake.
treatment: Consult a healthcare provider, follow medication if prescribed, monitor blood sugar levels.

name: Hypertension
description: A condition in which the force of the blood against the artery walls is too high.
prevention: Reduce salt intake, exercise regularly, limit alcohol consumption, manage stress.
treatment: Use prescribed medication, maintain a healthy lifestyle, monitor blood pressure regularly.

name: Asthma
description: A respiratory condition that causes difficulty in breathing due to airway inflammation.
prevention: Avoid allergens, use air purifiers, stay away from smoke.
treatment: Use inhalers, follow prescribed medications, avoid triggers.

name: Malaria
description: A mosquito-borne infectious disease causing fever, chills, and flu-like symptoms.
prevention: Use mosquito nets, wear protective clothing, take anti-malarial medications.
treatment: Consult a healthcare provider for medication, use antimalarial drugs.

name: Tuberculosis
description: A bacterial infection that mainly affects the lungs but can affect other parts of the body.
prevention: Complete TB vaccination, avoid close contact with infected people.
treatment: Follow a prescribed course of antibiotics for several months.

name: Dengue Fever
description: A viral illness spread by mosquitoes that causes high fever and flu-like symptoms.
prevention: Use mosquito repellents, wear long-sleeved clothing, eliminate mosquito breeding sites.
treatment: Supportive treatment such as fluids and pain relievers, seek medical attention.

name: Cholera
description: A bacterial infection that causes severe diarrhea and dehydration.
prevention: Drink clean water, practice good hygiene, use proper sanitation.
treatment: Rehydration therapy, antibiotics in severe cases.

name: Chickenpox
description: A highly contagious viral infection that causes an itchy skin rash with red spots and blisters.
prevention: Vaccination, avoid close contact with infected individuals.
treatment: Antihistamines for itching, pain relievers, consult a doctor.

name: Hepatitis B
description: A viral infection that attacks the liver and can cause both acute and chronic diseases.
prevention: Get vaccinated, avoid sharing needles, safe sex practices.
treatment: Antiviral medications, liver transplant in severe cases.

name: Typhoid Fever
description: A bacterial infection caused by Salmonella typhi, causing high fever and gastrointestinal symptoms.
prevention: Drink clean water, avoid contaminated food, vaccination.
treatment: Antibiotics, rehydration.

name: HIV/AIDS
description: A virus that attacks the immune system, weakening the body’s ability to fight infections.
prevention: Use protection during sexual activity, avoid sharing needles, get tested regularly.
treatment: Antiretroviral therapy (ART) to manage HIV, regular monitoring of immune system.

name: Pneumonia
description: An infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs, which may fill with fluid.
prevention: Vaccination, avoid smoking, practice good hygiene.
treatment: Antibiotics, pain relievers, rest, fluids.

name: Leprosy
description: A chronic infectious disease that primarily affects the skin, peripheral nerves, upper respiratory tract, and eyes.
prevention: Early detection, avoid prolonged contact with infected persons.
treatment: Multi-drug therapy (MDT).

name: Mental Health Disorders
description: A range of conditions that affect a person’s mood, thinking, and behavior.
prevention: Stress management, therapy, healthy lifestyle.
treatment: Therapy, medication, counseling.

name: Cervical Cancer
description: Cancer that occurs in the cells of the cervix, often caused by the human papillomavirus (HPV).
prevention: HPV vaccination, regular pap smears.
treatment: Surgery, chemotherapy, radiation therapy.

name: Osteoarthritis
description: A type of arthritis that occurs when the cartilage that cushions the joints breaks down.
prevention: Maintain healthy weight, regular exercise, avoid injury.
treatment: Pain relief medication, physical therapy, joint replacement surgery.

name: Stroke
description: A medical emergency where poor blood flow to the brain causes brain tissue damage.
prevention: Control blood pressure, healthy diet, exercise.
treatment: Emergency medical care, rehabilitation, and surgery in some cases.

name: Kidney Disease
description: A condition that impairs the function of the kidneys and can lead to kidney failure.
prevention: Avoid smoking, manage diabetes, control high blood pressure.
treatment: Dialysis, kidney transplant, manage underlying conditions.

name: Gallstones
description: Small, hard deposits that form in the gallbladder, which can block bile ducts.
prevention: Healthy diet, avoid excessive alcohol consumption.
treatment: Surgery to remove the gallbladder, medications.

name: Anemia
description: A condition where you don't have enough healthy red blood cells to carry adequate oxygen to your body's tissues.
prevention: Eat iron-rich foods, avoid excessive blood loss.
treatment: Iron supplements, vitamin B12 injections, blood transfusions.

name: Psoriasis
description: A skin condition where skin cells build up and form scales and itchy, dry patches.
prevention: Avoid triggers like stress and skin injury.
treatment: Topical treatments, light therapy, medications.

name: Epilepsy
description: A neurological disorder that causes seizures.
prevention: Proper medication, avoid triggers.
treatment: Anti-seizure medications, lifestyle adjustments.

name: Acid Reflux
description: A condition where stomach acid flows back into the esophagus causing heartburn.
prevention: Avoid spicy food, eat smaller meals, avoid lying down after meals.
treatment: Antacids, proton pump inhibitors.

name: Acne
description: A skin condition that causes pimples, blackheads, and cysts, typically on the face, back, and shoulders.
prevention: Clean skin regularly, avoid excessive oil production.
treatment: Topical treatments, antibiotics, oral medication.
